The "SC Crossings" application is a free electronic service provided by the Suez Canal Authority to facilitate people’s crossing through the various available points.
The application is available in English and Arabic.
The application’s design offers a user-friendly interface to make the following points available:
- Showing the crossing point status (open – closed) and its traffic density.
- Showing the crossing point operation hours.
- Notifying the user of any changes in the crossing point operation hours or emergencies at any of them.
- Showing the types of permissible vehicles into each crossing point.
- Showing crossing alternatives for the user in case one of the points is closed via the user’s phone GPS.
- Showing the crossing tolls and the available payment methods.
- Showing the subscription fees and the paperwork required for the service.
- Showing the crossing instructions for each point and a brief synopsis of it.
- Receiving inquiries and suggestions. 
- Presenting SCA news and providing a link to its official website.

Moovit is one app for all your urban mobility and transit rides. 

Transportation is an integral part of urban living. Whether you ride the train, subway, bus, light rail, ferry or metro, use dockless scooters, bikes, ride-sharing like Uber or Lyft, getting the best urban mobility information is critical. Enter Moovit! Moovit provides riders with a one-stop-shop journey experience to help them get from point A to B in the easiest and most efficient way. Get train and bus times, maps, and real-time arrival information with ease so that you can plan your trip with confidence. Pay and validate your rides. Find critical alerts and service disruptions for your favorite lines. Get step-by-step directions of optimal route bus, train, metro, bike, scooter or a combination of them. 

Moovit guides more than 930 million users in over 3400 cities throughout the world. Commuters will find updated bus and train times, transit maps, and, where available, real-time line arrivals. Locate nearby bus stops and train stations, travel with on-the-go live navigation guidance, receive get-off alerts when approaching your destination to ensure a smooth ride. That's why Moovit has been named one of the best apps of the year in 2017 by the App Store.

Moovit is your personal assistant for all your transit rides! 

► Real-time arrivals. View real-time arrival information, which is taken directly from GPS devices positioned on buses and trains. Avoid wasting time guessing train times or bus times.

► Digital payment. Purchase bus & train tickets and validate your digital pass with a tap (select cities). 

► Real time alerts. Know about issues ahead of time by receiving service alerts such as emergency or unexpected disruptions, delays, traffic jams, new construction, and more so that you can plan ahead if your bus time or train time changed.

► Live Directions. Get step-by-step bus directions and other transit directions with live guidance from A-to-B: Know how long you need to walk to your station, view your line's arrival time, receive get-off alerts as you approach your destination, and more. 

► Visualize Your Stop. Use augmented reality to locate your bus or train stop with "Way Finder".

► User reports. Moovit’s users report issues found with stations, line service, and schedules so that we can inform all nearby riders about what’s going on in their area.

► Favorite lines, stations, and places. Get easy access to lines, stations, and places you ride and visit all the time. Plus, get real-time updates if/when there are changes to your favorite lines in case your bus time or train time is impacted!

► Bike routes. Get bike routes in addition to the bus, subway, train, or metro trip plans. If you ride bikes (yours or shared) we can plan a route that includes the train or bus. Moovit will help you plan a trip that meets your transit-needs. Bike docking stations are updated in real-time. Bike trip plans are only available in supported metro areas.

► Maps view. Interested in seeing the whole picture? View all stations, routes, and lines on the subway or bus map. Additionally, maps are available in PDF for when you’re offline, or underground on the subway.

You can use Speed Camera Radar to detect hazards on the road, such as speed cameras, red-light cameras, speed bumps, bad roads, etc.
The application uses a database of points filled with love by other users.

Find your country or region from the list, and you're good to go! You will see all the alerts on the map.
Turn on the detection, and the application will warn you when something on the way is about to spoil your day.
Not interested in some types of hazards? Filter them out on the preferences page.
Contribute! Rate down the hazard if you hadn't seen it or thumbs up if it's on the place. We will remove threats with low ratings as invalid.
Add you're highly welcome to add your own points if they are not in the database.

Be careful on the road and good luck!

The workflow of the application differs from the hardware radar detector. Hardware radar detector - is a passive receiver that does not block the signal to which it is set, but simply notify the driver of the presence in the field of the radar radio interference.
This application works differently: it uses a database of hazards previously detected by other users.

title.label: Speed Camera Radar Detector - Sergei Semashko

summary.label:
Has it ever happened that you have to meet someone and the person can't explain where he/she is? This app will quickly find the location of another phone by sending a text message request. Most phones manufactured after 2010 can accept this request, no need to install any additional app on the 2nd person's phone. It does not get any easier than this!

How it is working:

• User A wants to know a User B location.

• User A enters the phone number of User B into the app.

• The app generates a unique URL, and the URL is sent to User B.

• If User B clicks on the link, user A will see the location of user B.

Limitations:

• This is not a spy app. User B must agree to share the location with you.

• If User B has a device without GPS (desktop computer, tablet), the determined location may have a large accuracy margin (up to 5 km).

• In rare situations, when user B is behind the corporate proxy, the app can show the proxy's location, not the user's.

The user location is determined in three ways:

• E.123, E.164
• RIR
• W3C Geolocation API

Are you wondering how it is possible that all this information appears live on your smartphone or tablet? Most modern ships have an AIS (Automatic Identification System) transceiver installed. This transceiver then sends the marine traffic information to a network of ship traffic stations around the world, so that you can see the exact current ship position and details about the ship.

Live flight tracker app: It has never been so easy to track flights! Do you just want to watch which planes are currently flying above your house or do you want to know where the flight from your friends, family or business contacts is now? Do this easily with this flight status tracker. This app allows locating and tracking flights – whether domestic or international, short or long – all this is live and free.

Using this flight radar is very simple. Search for a flight by entering the flight number or by using the flight tracking map and selecting the plane. You will then be shown various details about this plane and its current route.

Available plane details:
-aircraft type and photos
-airline and flight number
-flight origin and destination airports
-departure and arrival time
-altitude, speed and heading
-signal source and accuracy

This live flight radar app also contains an airport map. With this map you can find out the most important information about large and small airports from all over the world with just one click.

A compass is also integrated into this tracking app. This easy-to-use compass helps you to determine your own current position and thus helps you spotting planes with the flight radar map around your current location.

Flight tracking is exciting for several reasons. As an aviation fan, you can track flights just with one free flight radar app from your smartphone or tablet. You get more information about the current flight status than at the airport. If your friends or family are on a plane, you can easily track their flight online in real time. The practical thing is that this easy flight tracker app helps you get to the airport in time should a flight landed earlier or be delayed.

Are you wondering how it is possible that all this information appears live on your smartphone or tablet? Most modern aircraft have an ADS-B (Automatic Dependent Surveillance Broadcast) transponder installed. This transponder then transmits the air traffic information to a network of ground stations around the world, so that you can see the exact current flight position and details about the aircraft.

Download the free flight tracker app now!

OpenSeaMap data is now accessible from within the app giving the possibility of showing the map data delivered by OpenSeaMap which includes seamarks, navigational rules and buoys in many areas of the world.

Built-in compass and "direction" vector which helps find the direction of the ships and vessels.

Furthermore, by pressing the waypoint the position is copied to the clipboard, making it easy to paste positions into other applications. Pressing the callout of the waypoint will prepare a text message with the position ready to send to other users.Once the text message is received the user can press it and get the position up in various maps apps. This functionality has been requested by search and rescue workers who would like a tool to help pin point positions to colleagues out at sea.

Reloading of your Navigo pass, routes, real-time timetables, traffic info. Vianavigo is evolving and becoming Île-de-France Mobilités to better support you on a daily basis: train, RER, metro, tram, bus, car, bicycle, Vélib', carpooling, carsharing... Find the essential tools and information for organizing your travel in Île-de-France. Together, let's travel with ease.

Avoid queues at the station: recharge your Navigo pass from your phone!
- Recharge your Navigo pass by simply placing it on the back of your iPhone
- On vibration, your pass is detected and ready to be recharged
- You also have the option of paying for your tickets with Apple Pay

This service is compatible from an iPhone 7, with at least version iOS 13. iPhones XR and XS are compatible from iOS 14.5.

You can prepare and plan your trips:
- Find bus stops, train stations and metro stations near you
- Search in real time for your routes by public transport, carpooling and cycling
- Save your upcoming journeys on your phone's calendar
- Consult the next passages of your lines in real time and all the timetables
- View maps of public transport networks (accessible even offline)
- Follow the pedestrian route for the walking sections
- Buy a daily Vélib' pass and collect it with your Navigo pass

Be the first informed and anticipate disruptions:
- Consult the Twitter feed of your lines to know the traffic info in real time
- Be alerted in the event of disruptions on your favorite lines and routes
- Stay informed about the status of the elevators in the stations used

Personalize your trips:
- Save your destinations (work, home, gym, etc.), stations and stations as favorites
- Customize your profile (fast walker, with difficulty, reduced mobility, etc.)
- Select lines or stations to avoid

Choose soft or alternative modes of transport:
- Opt for the bike routes offered during your journeys
- Book your carpooling and/or carsharing journeys, in partnership with the main French players

Bugs or remarks to report to us? Help us improve by sending us your suggestions from the contact form available via the menu.
